name: 1910 Main - An American Bistro
review_description: The place was deserted, but we had a great meal.

name: RingSide Fish House - Fox Tower
review_description: Appetizers were wonderful for the most part. Dungeness crab cakes were great, oysters were great, steak tartar however was mediocre. Chef's Special Rockfish was good, but overpriced. Had rockfish at a local restaurant for almost half the price that was better. The halibut was dry, overseasoned and overpriced. This was my second time here. First time was really good. This time, not so much. Wont recommend. Will not return. Will still recommend the steak house though.

name: RingSide Steakhouse - Uptown
review_description: Attentive service without being overly fussy, great menu options.. Incredibly good meal

name: Newport Seafood Grill - Lloyd Center
review_description: We had a group of 17 (from White Rock, Canada) and went to the Newport seafood Grill to celebrate finishing the Seattle to Portland bike ride. The service and food were excellent - especially given that we had such a large group! Thanks for accommodating such a large group!

name: Sunday Antidote
review_description: I find the idea of sitting and watching the chef prepare our food and talk to us about what he's doing. He changed the menu at the last minute because of what he found at the farmers market. He is very passionate about food and would recommend this to anyone who is a foodie or wants a personal brunch experience.

name: Angel Thai
review_description: Always yummy food. The Thai Salad with peanut sauce dressing is the best salad in Bend. The Orange Chicken is addicting. Most dishes, including the salad are big enough to share.

name: Larks - Home Kitchen Cuisine at The Ashland Springs Hotel
review_description: As always, a most pleasant experience. It's tourist season here now and the restaurant was very busy at lunch time. But I still enjoyed every minute while there. I have a volunteer job at OSF, greeting visitors and answering questions about the theaters and Ashland. I always recommend Lark's because I know how much being at Lark's will add to the experience of a visit to Ashland and OSF.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Vancouver
review_description: My husband ordered a steak meal and it was great. I ordered a salad with steak and it was okay. There really wasn't much lettuce and I did not like a warm steak on a cool salad. The only other issue was despite it being really slow at the restaurant, our service was pretty much non existent.

name: Portland City Grill
review_description: Undoubtably the best dining experience available in Portland. If you want to see how a restaurant should be go to the Portland City Grill. The Management and the Chef have developed teams that excel in the front of the house and back. The food....superb, imaginative, creative, delicious. A blend of flavors and nuances that delight, excite and leave you wondering why others cannot prepare food this good. The service...the best in Portland. Hands down, the best in Portland. Attentive, polite and professional. From the Host Staff to the Servers to the Management, everyone displayed professionalism in their jobs. This is where you go when you want to impress your friends, business associates or significant other.

name: El Gaucho - Portland
review_description: Me and my wife to dinner here for no specific reason but we had a good time and didn't want to leave until the end of the night. The music was good and i will be back again!

name: Beast
review_description: The food was outstanding...6 courses of culinary genius. It was even better having prepared right in front of you. The atmosphere was surprisingly fun and energetic with the two group tables, adjacent kitchen, and knowledgable staff. I highly recommend you get here as quickly as you can.

name: Benihana - Beaverton
review_description: Great food! I highly recommend the Surf Side: shrimp, calamari and scallops. We actually arrived 30 minutes early and they were able to seat us. For birthday's they send you a $30 certificate to your e-mail if you sign up online. The birthday boy/girl (man/woman) gets free ice cream and a photo to take home. A fun experience!

name: Flatbread Community Oven - Bend
address: 375 SW Powerhouse Drive STE 130 Bend, OR  97702
review_description: We spent 3 weeks in Italy and this is the only restaurant in Bend that makes authentic Italian pizza. Great thin crust and not overloaded with ingredients. It is one of our favorite spots in Bend. Outdoor seating in summer and a nice warm and cozy atmosphere in the winter with fireplace. All ingredients very fresh.

name: Cassidy's Restaurant & Bar
review_description: Great bartenders the chef if amazing. I travel for work and this is one of my favorite places on the West Coast now

name: The Boulevard Grill
review_description: Very disappointing food. Two of us had the prime rib, and both meals seemed "warmed-up" via microwave, and not freshly sliced prime rib. (Also both were supposed to be cooked medium, but both were served well done"). The third guest had the fish and chips and liked them. Generally, the price of the meals are too expensive for the quality of food served.

name: Henry's 12th Street Tavern
review_description: Food was good, polite staff but they weren‰Ûªt very attentive. When we were seated they were very helpful but after ordering we didn‰Ûªt see our waitress but once. Whenn we were done and asking for to go containers to getting our check and paying took 45 minutes which kind of put a damper on a nice evening for my sons 21st birthday. The ohter thing is they need much better high chairs, a small strap across their legs just above the knee doen't work very well to contain a toddler.

name: The Vintage Room at The Reserve Golf Course
review_description: We sat outside this visit and the view was fantastic!! The food was not quite as good as usual but it was still a great dining experience......

name: Roots Restaurant and Bar
review_description: We had not been to Roots in over a year since our last visit was disappointing. However, this time the filet mignon was excellent and although as other reviews mentioned the prices can be a little high, I don't mind paying that if the steak is done properly. The service was also noteworthy. I would definitely recommend it again to friends.

name: The Brickhouse - Redmond
review_description: Great meal- quality meat and satisfying portions. The service was welcoming and thoughtful. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

name: Paragon - Portland
review_description: Although the food was good the menu was lacking.Paragon was a disapointent the second time around.

name: Stanford's - Jantzen Beach
address: 1440 N Jantzen Beach Ctr Portland, OR  97217
review_description: We left because service was very slow. Perhaps it was too busy for the amount of help available for a hot Wednesday night. Stanford's is usually a nice place to go.

name: Chart House Restaurant - Portland
review_description: Best spinach salad in town. Very nice seafood

name: a Cena Ristorante
review_description: Amazing service and wine list. Cute little neighborhood with lots of bars and restaurants. Cena is definitely worth checking out. My wife recommends the lemoncellotini ;-).

name: The Joel Palmer House
review_description: One of the best dining experiences we've ever had. It was our anniversary dinner, and we were treated like royalty. Very friendly staff. Loved every minute of it. No negatives at all. Very ingenious food, brilliantly prepared. Kudos!

name: Morton's The Steakhouse - Portland
review_description: Great spot for a upscale birthday celebration- no singing but they take a souvenir photo (like on a cruise) and provide a complimentary dessert. Service was great and the jumbo shrimp were the best my husband has ever had. Thanks for a memorable celebration!

name: Salty's on the Columbia
review_description: An important Family Special Event From the momment we walked through the door we were treated that way.The view is impressive

name: Brix Tavern
review_description: It was ok. We had made reservations for a group of about 20-30 for a party. The process of making reservations and working with Annette was good. However, they don't have air conditioning and we were there on one of the hottest days of summer. It was very warm in there. The service was slow. I only tried two items and found the food to be ok but not great.

name: Sweetwaters on the River
review_description: Great setting outdoors. Enjoyable wine and salad. Meat overcooked and not enjoyed. Hold your sever to your request if the kitchen fumbles it!

name: DaVinci Ristorante & Wine Bar
review_description: My wife and I went there for our anniversary. As always, we were treated as though they did not have anyone else but us to worry about. The menu was sharp and the wine discussion with our server was just what we needed. The food was excellent and we ended up sharing each other's plate. Dessert was suggested and well done. Afterwards, we went downstairs and just hung out in the wine bar with some Port and Scotch. The service here too was excellent. Great place to eat!

name: The Lodge Restaurant at Black Butte Ranch
address: 12930 Hawks Beard Black Butte Ranch, OR  97759
review_description: We have had some excellent meals at the Lodge Restaurant (we are owners at BBR, and have eaten there many times), but this was not one of them. My wife and daughter shared the pork tenderloin, and neither of them liked it. They also each had a cup of the special soup, and, again, were not impressed. I had a special, pasta with lobster mushrooms, which was really poor--I couldn't finish it. The tomato/mozzarella salad was excellent; we had good wines by the glass. Service was fine. My daughter had to sit with sun in her face.

name: Lapellah Restaurant
address: 2520 Columbia House Blvd. Suite 108 Vancouver, WA  98661
review_description: Service was great as usual. We ordered off the happy hour menu this time and it was an incredible value with normal size plates. Not smaller sizes as some places. The Friday night bar and happy hour is crowded but they do an exceptional job of getting people seated. Happy hour is at all seats not just the bar.

name: DOC
review_description: Food was amazing for the multi-course tasting option. Server was a little curt and when speaking would trail off so that made it a little difficult to understand her.

name: The Phoenix Restaurant
review_description: We were staying in Bend for a concert and thought The Phoenix would be a good restaurant to hit up on our way. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly and the food was delicious. We ordered off the 3 course menu and got quite a bit of food. My husband had the salmon piccata and I had the fish and chips. They brought us fresh baked bread and we would definitely when vacationing in Bend again.

name: Amuse Restaurant
review_description: This is our favorite restaurant in Ashland - we always make sure to reserve well in advance when we attend the Shakespeare Festival each year. Dining at Amuse is one of the highlights of our visit.

name: del INTI Restaurant
review_description: good visual presentations of delicious food choicesdo not look for a mango daiquiryquick service and friendly waiters

name: Paulee
review_description: There are two rooms in this restaurant. I had made reservations several weeks prior, and initially was put in front room. This room has no ambience. The other room has an open kitchen and fireplace and much better ambience. I was able to change rooms although with reluctance. (turns out were several empty tables during entire time). So I recomend asking for inner room.

name: Cabezon Restaurant and Fish Market
review_description: Interesting and varied menu consisting of small, medium, and large plates. Delicious preparations. A real treat.

name: McCormick's Fish House - Beaverton
review_description: The food does not justify the prices..

name: Fivespice Seafood & Wine Bar
address: 315 First Street Suite 201 Lake Oswego, OR  97034
review_description: This is a very good seafood restaurant, but quite noisy. My husband and I opted to sit outside which turned out to make the evening a wonderful time for us. We were then able to truly enjoy the delicious food and our time together.

name: Fratelli Ristorante & Bar
review_description: We had a very enjoyable dinner, great waiter.

name: Gilda's Italian Restaurant
review_description: I'd never known of Gilda's until we had a gift certificate given us. The place is very romantic, the paintings envelope one in the encircled restaurant, the food is divine. Homemade pasta and cannol made the Sicilian way with ricotta. Definitely a great find.We'll be back.

name: Zeppo Italian Restaurant
review_description: Based on quality alone the wines are overpriced. Other local restaurants have better wines, larger pours, and a better variety during happy hour.

name: Greg's Grill
review_description: Being from out of town, we wanted to end our trip to Bend with a nice dinner out. We picked the right place. Making online reservations was easy and allowed us to be seated right away even during the dinner rush. All of the staff & servers were friendly & professional. The setting was beautiful - river view while the sun was setting. Food was delicious - lots of appetizers and specials to choose from. So happy we saved room for dessert! It was a great way to end our vacation and we'll be back next time we visit Bend.

name: The Heathman Restaurant
review_description: It was very enjoyable. I particularly liked that it was quiet. I could converse with my party very easily.

name: Natural Selection
review_description: Everything about Natural Selection was excellent except one thing: the temperature inside the restaurant. It was a rare, hot summer night in Portland and the restaurant was stifling. It nearly ruined our meal. I'm not saying I won't go back, but I will be careful of the weather. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this restaurant to vegetarians looking for something different and folks who are into food.

name: Hola! Sunriver
review_description: Food was outstanding as was the service ! Bravo

name: Huber's Restaurant
review_description: The food was adequate, but overpriced for what it was. The cheesecake had a plastic quality, like what I'd find in a chain restaurant, which was hardly what I was looking for when I chose a Portland landmark.

name: 900 Wall
review_description: Great location. Food/wine was amazing.

name: Accanto
review_description: Great service and excellent food!

name: Andina
review_description: Absolutely superb service and excellent food. The noise level was a bit high, and the restaurant was quite busy - I don't know that I'd recommend this for a romantic meal, but I do highly recommend it for the high quality and inventive food and the incredible service. Without a doubt I'd be happy to go again.

name: Aviary
review_description: Aviary didn't dissapoint. My wife and I recently went there for our 10th anniversary, and the food and service were top-notch. If you like asian, french, and northwest cuisine, you'll find a lot to like at Aviary. The chefs are playful and creative, and we had numerous "mouthgasms" at this restaurant. The only real negative, which didn't bother us, is that the place is a bit loud. But we were tucked away in a relatively quiet corner and it didn't impact us much. And while the plates aren't very large, it does give you an opportunity to sample a number of dishes (they offered to split the soup for us -- which was a nice touch). Great spot on Alberta!

name: Beaker & Flask
review_description: Great birthday dinner! Loved the mussels/clams pork belly entree! Yum drinks.

name: Bluehour
review_description: The ambiance is outstanding.The server also was topnotch.The starters were also very good. the let down occurred when we tasted the main courses.My wife ordered the halibut, it was so strong tasting that she was tempted to send it back to the kitchen.I ordered the chicken it was ordinary ,at best . At the prices they command ,one would expect higher quality food.

name: Brasserie Montmartre
review_description: I was impressed by the menu, wine list and the knowledge from the Bar staff. We opted to sit outside, but our server was pretty much MIA the entire time. We purchased a bottle of wine, but basically poured our own water and wine the entire time. We also had to locate the server to order more food. After we finished, we had to ask for the check. We were not charged for the wine and let the server know. The server did return with the revised check, but went MIA again. We basically had to take it up front to pay the check. Over-all, the experience could have been great if the server was attentive. Not all the tables were full, so we are not sure what happened. If we do return, we will sit inside.

name: clarklewis
review_description: Clarklewis is truly one of the finest restaurants in Portland, and these days, that is quite an accomplishment. I took my family of 4 (including 2 bottomless teens) for a night of fine dining, and everything on the Italian-esque menu was superb. We ordered the $55/person tasting menu (everyone at the table has to go for it) and they brought literally everything on the menu - 3 or 4 appetizers, salads, pastas, entres, and desserts. We had to take some home in a box - with my boys and fine dining, that may be the first time ever!

name: Cocotte
review_description: As always, Cocotte came through with a fantastic dining experience. Food and service were both exemplary as we've come to expect. We don't understand why there is not always a line out the door of this place! Do Portlanders really know anything about good food??? Hmmmmm.

name: Coppia/Vino Paradiso
review_description: Loved it! The food was mouthwatering and I liked everything. The service was amazing, our server brought us recommended wine with our dishes to try. He was always on top of everything. Our glasses were always full and he made sure we had a good transition from the main to the dessert.

name: Del Alma
address: 136 SW Washington Ave STE 102 Corvallis, OR  97333
review_description: We sat outside and it was a beautiful day. Only four tables outside and service wasn't stellar which has been my experience in the past. I think they had a large party that maybe was slowing things down. I really like Del Alma however and will return.

name: Departure Restaurant and Lounge
review_description: We had an excellent experience for my friend's birthday. Excellent service for our large group and the food, as always, was wonderful.

name: Dragonwell Bistro
review_description: Not your typical Chinese restaurant - decor is elegant, service is attentive but not intruding, food is expertly prepared and a delight to the eyes as well as the palate. We ordered four entrees for four (rice is not included). Each of us raved about three of the dishes and were less enthusiastic about the fourth - but each of us had different three favorites.

name: East India Co. Grill & Bar
review_description: Unorganized wait staff. Our host/waitress was rude and not helpful. She seemed as if she didn't want to be there.

name: Broken Bread
review_description: We had a 6:00 reservation. We were the only ones there. Another couple came in during our stay & ate on the patio. We started out there, but it was too windy and traffic noise was too much. I ordered farm salad and duck legs and my husband the soup and meat loaf. The soup and salad were good, as well as the bread. The grilled veggies we both had were good too. But, the duck and meat loaf were over done. Yes, the duck "fell off the bone," like the waiter said, but it was dry and cooked with a burnt sugar "glaze" that was so strong I couldn't taste any duck flavor. And I did not the care at all for the confeit. The meat loaf had the same glaze & was just okay. I like the idea of using products from local farmers, but we won't be back.

name: Elevation
address: 2555 NW Campus Village Way Bend, OR  97701
review_description: I love Elevation! It is an extremely enjoyable experience being served by the students. The food was tasty and well-presented. I give Elevation nothing but high marks.

name: Genoa Restaurant
review_description: Overall a very good experience. All courses were delicious & interesting. Service was excellent. A really enjoyable evening

name: Gilt Club
review_description: LOVE this little gem. On the edge of the Pearl District, we stumbled upon Gilt out first night in Portland. We THOUGHT we were foodies until Gilt... Both the bartender and the chef broadened our horizons in the most fascinating and delicious ways. Recommend the Bocadillo cocktail. It is "out there" but fits right in in Portland!

name: H5O bistro & bar
review_description: The food was amazing. We had the truffle fries, salmon, steak and soup along with dessert and everyone was satisfied.

name: Iorio Restaurant
review_description: We have been in Portland for 12 years living on a teachers salary we don't often get to sample the higher end restaurants. After much study for our anniversary we picked Iorios. It was a smashing success. Great atmosphere, the waitstaff were attentive without hovering, The owner, Chris, visited every table and welcomed everyone, but all that aside it is really about the food which was wonderful. My husband is spoiled by my cooking and would rather eat at home, I love going out. The food at Iorios satisfied both of us. Please go, you will not be disappointed.

name: Ivories Jazz Lounge and Restaurant
review_description: Great place to have a snack & listen to music. Food is not that special.

name: June
review_description: Hands down one of the best meals I've had in PDX ever!

name: Le Pigeon
review_description: Amazing food and service!! One of the best meals I've had. Get the foie gras profiteroles, you won't be sorry! Great foodie restaurant without being stuffy.

name: Limo Peruvian Restaurant
review_description: Very good food. Service spotty. Very warm evening and sat outside. Not all workers knowledgable about the menu. Had classic ceviche. Very generous portion, but almost too much lime juice. Had octopus potato appetizer. Very nice presentation and great flavor, but octopus a little chewy. Cau Cau for entree which was excellent, but rice was a little underdone. Reasonably priced.

name: Lincoln Restaurant
address: 3808 N Williams Ave Ste 127 Portland, OR  97227-1468
review_description: Lincoln continues to be one of my all time favorites, especially for visiting guests.

name: Little Bird
review_description: this was our first time dining at Little Bird. We are foodies and we loved the food. We had the trout and the duck and both were excellent, beautifully prepared and presented. This restaurant will become a favorite of ours.

name: Madison's Grill
review_description: Made reservations at Madison's Grill for a group of 15 folks looking for a great lunch spot. We were a little late, no problem! The service provided by Madison's staff was great, very friendly. Everyone enjoyed the food, especially the onion rings.

name: Mama Mia Trattoria
review_description: The small room to the side of the dining area is great for small meetings [could hear everyone].

name: Masu Sushi
review_description: This was my first Masu dining experience and i was completely "wow'd" from the appetizers to the sake selections. The waitress gladly recommended her own favorites when we asked. Which all turned out to great pics! I'm already planning my return tripz Awesome! Make sure you try the mount saint helenz sushi roll!! You'll be surprise how awesome the dish is!

name: Meriwether's Restaurant & Skyline Farm
review_description: This was a 3rd time at Meriwether's--other 2 were for lunch. The service was very good compared to lunch slowness and incompetence. The waiter was helpful, and paid attention to our needs without intruding. Too bad they were out of the specials by our 8:00 pm reservation. We did have to wait for half an hour, even though the table we were seated at was sitting empty from the time we came in, not sure what that was about except the hostess seemed scattered and not on top of the turn overs. The patio ambiance was magical. Be aware, the portions are tiny from the boards up to full entrees, so expect to do 3-4 courses to be full. Overall a pleasant experience with friends.

name: Monteaux's Public House
address: 16165 SW Regatta Lane, STE 1000 Beaverton, OR  97006
review_description: food and service were GREAT! we will be going back for sure! The waiter was very friendly and honest when asked about menu.

name: Ned Ludd
review_description: Lovely summer dinner, the waitstaff was friendly but unobtrusive and the dining room is adorable.

name: The Original
review_description: Took my wife too the Oregon coast for her birthday and spent a couple nights enjoying the sights and sounds of Portland. Looking for a cool place for brunch our last day and found the Original and what a find. Cool place, great people and outstanding food. Food is off the chart and the polenta cakes my wife had were to die for. Keep up the good eats.Don D - Colorado Springs CO.

name: Ox & Fin
review_description: Our last meal at Osteria Sfizio, as it now has a new name. We are hoping for the same wonderful food and atmosphere in the future.

name: Paadee
review_description: Great cocktails and happy hour menu. Air conditioning was weak on very hot day--so we were eager to leave as it was uncomfortably warm, but the food would take me back.

name: Park Kitchen
review_description: Amazing place. I booked the reservation a few months before traveling based on the reviews on the OpenTable website. We were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and travel to Portland, OR from Seattle, WA for the weekend. The waitstaff were courteous and polite. We ordered from the appetizer/small plate section and everything we had was superb -- from the cucumber soup with shrimp to tuna salad or the flank steak salad. The double chocolate tart with hazelnut ice cream was the perfect was to end the evening.

name: Pine Tavern Restaurant
review_description: This is a nice neighborhood restaurant. The food is standard fare, but not memorable. The kitchen was efficient, but I can't see why they charge $8 to split a dish. The prime rib looked great, and my dinner guest said it was very succulent. He enjoyed the brusselsprout salad as well. I had the Dungeness Crab Louie, and that was a bit disappointing. The dressing was great though, and they will serve it on the side. The kids ordered macaroni and cheese, and I was surprised it came out in such a big bowl. Neither of the kids finished it, and I felt like we could have split one order for them both. The highlight of the night was the dessert that the waitress brought out for the birthday boy! It was a huge piece of ice cream cake!

name: Portland Seafood Co. - Mall 205
review_description: My friends GPS gave him directions to the restaurant on the other side of town. The staff was very nice and attentive to me while I waited the 40 minutes until he arrived. We had the crusted halibut that was very tasty and cooked well. I loved the New England Chowder but neither one of us liked the Manhattan fish chowder very well. Other than that, super dining experience and we will be back.

name: Portland Seafood Co. - Washington Square
address: 9699 SW Washtington Square Road Tigard, OR  97223
review_description: There was 10 in our party. The food took a very long time to arrive (longer than it should have) and one person in our party asked for sugar three times and never got it. Sad. That being said, the food was very good. Mixed review.

name: Portobello Vegan Trattoria
address: 1125 SE Division Street Suite 102 Portland, OR  97202
review_description: A wonderful and most special dinner was had by the 6 of us. The food was AMAZING - we had the Beet Tartare, Mushrooms and trumpet mushroom fries with sauce for appetizers. Cocktails are tasty and creative and the service was exceptional. I had the Deep Cornmeal Pie and others at my table had the Gnocchi and the Manicotti...all were devoured. I will be back for sure!

name: Riffle NW
review_description: Food was excellent will be going again!

name: Saucebox
review_description: Loved Saucebox and cannot wait to go back.

name: Serratto
review_description: We were able to sit outside on a lovely evening. The services was some of the best we have experienced in Portland. I had the rack of lamb and he had the cioppino, both were outstanding.

name: St Jack
review_description: A fantastic "total package" restaurant with a strong emphasis on service and customer care

name: The Bay House (OR)
review_description: Wonderful food in an area with limited options. We've eaten there numerous times while staying at Salishan Resort and the food and service are always consistently great.

name: The Bent Brick
review_description: Great meal. If you're with a group that is game to get the whole menu, I would recommend it highly. It's a great way to taste everything and have a lot of fun doing it.

name: The Parish
review_description: Great food and service. I so miss The Cajun Cafe, NW 21st and Lovejoy, from years ago (the 80's maybe?)...I was VERY young then but remember it as being consistently so good! Hope Parish is around for a long time with more yummy Cajun dishes!

name: Thirst Wine Bar & Bistro
review_description: Poor and slow service. Very few choices on the menu.

name: Three Degrees
review_description: My experience there was somewhat colored by the noise level; but that was coming from the harbor and not the restaurant. So much for things out of the restaurant's control. Now to specifics: The food was simply amazing. Risotto is a difficult thing to make. They made it look easy; it was perfect. The steak was perfectly prepared, spiced just right and exactly the right temperature(true medium rare)- tender, juicy and virtually melted in the mouth. The chicken was simply perfect. This restaurant is probably worth 5 Michelin stars... I wonder if they've been rated... and the prices were commensurate with the setting, the quality and the ambiance. I'll be back.

name: Tabla Mediterranean Bistro
review_description: Great outdoor seating for a hot Portland night! Food and service wonderful.

name: Touche Restaurant & Bar
review_description: We went there for a birthday celebration. Made reservations and did not have to wait. It was surprisingly slow for a Saturday night at 7pm. Drink selection was limited due to a water advisory so that put a damper on our cocktail selection--no fault of the restaurant. I ordered a lemon chicken fettuchini dish which was not bad but not spectacular either (a little bland tasting with not alot of chicken).

name: Trader Vic's
review_description: A friend and I went to enjoy the anniversary dinner -- it was exceptional. I had a 1944 mai tai....oh so good. What would I change? First: how about some Hawaiian music? Second: the waiter was good, mostly, but inconsistent. Most astonishing, at 8:23, he came to the table to tell us to leave because someone was coming at 8:30. He'd been slow to bring the bill but suddenly, we had to leave. This unhospitable end to the evening was unsettling.

name: Urban Farmer
review_description: Had visited Urban Farmer twice prior for lunch and had a lovely dinner experience with some out of town friends. All of us had wonderful entrees and enjoyed the family style sides. Our server went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and welcome, and I can't wait to try the various cheeses on my next trip.

name: Urban Fondue
review_description: Great Martini's from their bar... Bartini.

name: The Wayfarer Restaurant and Lounge
review_description: In all fairness, a busy day at the beach but restaurant seemed understaffed. Prices were high for the portion of food. The Cedar Plank salmon tasted like the washed plank it was on instead of like salmon...would not recommend it on a busy night.

name: Wilf's Restaurant & Bar
address: 800 NW 6th Ave at Union Station Portland, OR  97209
review_description: Matrix Morpheus chairs a bit odd... Food is good but pricey jazz was good

name: The Woodsman Tavern
review_description: It was good, not outstanding. Perhaps the food we ordered was not representational. Salad with bitter lettuces was so, so. The dessert with chocolate ice cream and a coconut macaroon was so, so. However, the Trout and the Tuna Nicoise were very good.The restaurant is extremely noisy.

name: Yakuza Lounge
review_description: Wonderful... Open, modern, simple decor... The ribs are spectacular succulent, fall off.the bone, amazing Sauce. Presentation was lovely. Inventive cocktails. Our wait person was attentive but not intrusive. A great experience that will be repeated.

name: Gruner
review_description: We had spent time in Bavaria and loved the better-than-native dishes prepared at Gruner. Our server was excellent in explaining and recommending wine and food pairings. We were more than pleased with the fresh tomato salad, charcuterie, and the lamb and duck entrees. What a welcome change from the excellent but now common fresh food NW cuisine in Portland **** restaurants.

name: Metrovino
review_description: I took my husband here for his birthday. We loved it! Everything was delicious, and very beautifully presented. This place is a keeper!

name: decarli
review_description: Too loud, they didn't do anything special that I request for our anniversary and they mixed our drinks up.

name: Uptown Billiards Club
review_description: The place can be hard to spot if not for the umbrellas out front but you will not be disappointed once inside. The staff there are more than just friendly they treat you like a friend. The food is great (brie and four mushrooms pizza is awesome!)and the prices are very reasonable for such a beautifully decorated place. There's also billiard tables but you don't feel like you're in a pool hall. Very classy and can't wait to go back! Only bad thing, but you can say this about every place in Portland, is the parking. I ended up getting a parking ticket for a loading zone infraction. Bummer.

name: Stanford's - Clackamas
review_description: It being our first time to a Stanfords we had a great time and service was awesome.

name: Jake's Famous Crawfish
review_description: Great place to share NW cuisine with local or traveling family members and friends.

name: Jake's Grill - Portland
review_description: we enjoyed it and the staff was wonderful

name: Five-0-Three
review_description: The food quality is very good and prepared in clever ways. It is priced properly. This is a great go-to restaurant for a fresh, simple, tasty meal. We continue to return and always find delicious specials featuring seasonal foods.

name: Nora's Table
review_description: Ask for outdoor dining and was place at a table in front of the restaurant on the street. Very noisey. For some reason picked a steak and it was fair at best. Tough with little flavor.

name: Newport Bay - Tanasbourne
address: 2865 NW Town Center Loop Beaverton, OR  97006
review_description: This location is best for meeting family from multiple locations. The whole dining experience is great.

name: Adobe Resort - Oregon
review_description: Been going there for years and never have been disappointed.

name: Le Bouchon
review_description: Three 20+ year olds, two 40+ year olds and a 12 year old were all impressed by the quality of food and the quality of service. Enough said.

name: Red Star
review_description: My wife and I had a very special evening celebrating and our dinner at Red Star was superb!Our waiter, Rusty, was energetic, entertaining and very informative about weaving our way through the dining experience.He did an amazing job and at the end of dinner we discovered that he only recently started working at the Red Star. His level of service and knowledge of the menu rivaled that of the servers at Jake's!

name: Silk Vietnamese Restaurant
review_description: I normally enjoy Silk and conside myself a semi-regular there. The food is good and the cocktails are tasty. But the service just gets slower and slower every time I go. On the most recent visit the server announced on our arrival that it was "a bit slow for a first Thursday". Despite it being slower than they had anticipated, the service was still glacial. Drinks took 15 minutes to arrive, and the food was a long time coming too.Come on, Silk. You have a decent product here: yummy food and drinks. But you really have got to fix the service. It's not just slowness. Your people really just aren't on the ball, and walk past tables multiple times when drinks glasses are empty or plates need clearing. Time for retraining I think.

name: Davis Street Tavern
review_description: We went for lunch and it was very good. The only bad thing was they had music going and volume was too loud. It was hard to talk.

name: Jamison
review_description: The food was phenomenal. The tuna tartare was fresh and the flavors blended so well. The staff is very friendly, and extremely knowledgeable. We'll definitely go back.

name: Rivershore Bar & Grill
review_description: Difficult to find parking was our first impression. We had made reservations, but weren't asked when we arrived. Server brought the 'lemon water' I requested without lemon--twice. Every other table got bread; we had to ask for ours. The entrees took a LONG time to come. The food was average, nothing special. The salmon with lobster sauce that I had was the special. It tasted like BBQ sauce, but the salmon was pretty good. I would consider coming back for lunch if we got an outdoor table; but, probably won't come back for dinner. Unimpressive,

name: Vindalho
review_description: What an amazing place! We were very impressed with the food and service. We will be back, and back, and back again.

name: 23 Hoyt
review_description: We waited 15 minutes to have our orders taken. My wife and I each ordered a salad and a starter. It took about 20 minutes to get the salads, and 40 additional minutes to get our starters. Diners who arrived after us and ordered dinner entres received their food before we did. The waiter said that the manager apologized for the delay (didn't visit us in person) and that they'd give us 1 free dessert. Their dessert menu had 3 items. We were really disapointed, because we loved the ambience but received such poor service. I'd even written a note in my reservation that it was my wife and I's anniversary!

name: Mingo
review_description: It's one of my favorite restaurants in the burbs. The staff is welcoming, warm, friendly, and offer great service.

name: Castagna
review_description: We came to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary here and were not disappointed. What a joy to sit down with our group of friends and have our very attentive waiter start bringing us delicious and creative little nibbles. Creative combinations, fabulous textures, and beautiful presentation all came together in very delicious and exciting food. The wine selection looked fabulous, however we brought our own bottles, and to our great surprise, the restaurant comped our corkage as an anniversary gift to us. All in all, a very lovely evening at a very special restaurant!

name: Newport Seafood Grill - Salem
review_description: Service was mediocre. I had to ask three times for a refill of iced tea, and by the time they brought it I had finished my dinner. When we arrived, we waited 4 minutes for anyone to come to the front and greet us. The bartender and one server looked directly at us but didn't even acknowledge our existence. The food was done wrong the first time, but they quickly made it right. Food was good so I'll give them another chance, but the service will definitely need to step up a notch!

name: McCormick & Schmick's Harborside - Portland
review_description: The food and service was the best I've had in at a restaurant in a long time.

name: M & S Grill - Tigard
review_description: We had a wonderful dinner and our waiter was very attentive. It was our 38th wedding anniversary and they printed our anniversary date on the menu. We will certainly be back.

name: Smithfields
review_description: The food hit some real high notes and some rather low notes. And service was strange for a restaurant of this quality. We ordered appetizers --- bacon beignets which were out of this world --- and a watermelon platter also delicious. Before we could finish these treats, our entree's had arrived! We hadn't finished our cocktails yet! We had selected to split (per our server's suggestion) a large portion of beef. While delicious and delicately flavored, perfectly cooked, there was a significant amount of inedible connective tissue that made for an expensive and yucky addition to the corners of our plates. A moment of judicious butchery before cooking perhaps? And mashed potatoes seemed no salt/butter. How do you serve bland potatoes?

name: Noble Rot
address: 1111 East Burnside Fourth Floor Portland, OR  97214
review_description: What a great place! Food is great, service is fun and attentive , wonderful views , love the decor !!! All good! Our European guest was blown away, We'll be back!

name: Irving St Kitchen
review_description: First time eating here and we will be back in again this week! :) Lovely little brunch with the family. Food was delicious. I can't wait to try everything else!

name: The Blacksmith Restaurant
review_description: Great food and excellent service.

name: Hamburger Mary's
review_description: We had a largish group (12 people), and there weren't enough people on duty - it took 40 minutes before our order was taken, and another 50 minutes before we were served. Our waiter was cute and courteous, but he simply wasn't able to keep up with us and everybody else that was there that night.

name: Ping Restaurant
review_description: Fabulous food, flavors just pop in your mouth. Excellent cocktails.

name: Pink Rose
review_description: Love every aspect of this sweet little spot...everyone that works there is so amazing and friendly!! Highly recommend this to anyone who wants to enjoy a good meal great atmosphere and great service

name: Rock Bottom Brewery - Portland
review_description: The restaurant was too noisy. We took some family from out of town to dinner there and we had trouble carrying a conversation. It was way too loud around us. Wouldn't go back for interactions.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Portland
review_description: We love Ruth's for that special romantic evening. We went recently for or two year anniversary. Amazing streak and we lived the spicy lobster appetizer! Extremely convenient parking with the valet service that they will just add to your bill. Expect on spending close to$200 for a couple if you have drinks and appetizers. I love the Manhattan.

name: Daily Grill - Portland
review_description: Daily grill is only worth going to if you are staying at the Westin and do not have the energy to go elsewhere. With a few exceptions in the bar area most of the wait staff are slower than what I would expect. Also the food is a little pricey for what it is.

name: 3 Doors Down
review_description: The food and waiter service were fantastic! But there was some odd things that didn't sit well with me. We put "birthday party!" on the notes in the reservation, and either they didn't notice or didn't think it was important. After our meal, I ordered a local brandy. I was given a glass of grappa. The waiter was quick to take the grappa back, but then a guy in a red untucked polo shirt came over and said they were out of the local brandy, and that the calvados was better. It took me a beat to realize he was the bartender! I thought it was just kind of odd.

name: Apizza Scholls
review_description: great dining experience, we will be back.

name: Aquariva
review_description: Great view - Menu was very limited.

name: Bentley's Grill - The Grand Hotel in Salem
review_description: the food and service was excellent as usual.

name: La Capitale
review_description: We went here on a whim. Best decision we made. The food was fantastic. My husband, who is a chef, had the steak. To him, a steak is a steak is a steak. But THIS steak, was outstanding! It was cooked to perfection, was seasoned right and was so tender. The frites were awesome too! I had to roasted chicken which, again, was perfect. It fell off the bone.I highly recommend going. Service, food and atmosphere was great!

name: The Brickhouse - Bend
review_description: Went with a friend to enjoy a lazy,summer evening on the outdoor pation. Waitstaff picked up on our laid back attitude and were attentive yet unobtrusive during the meal. Gazpacho ceviche appetizer was on point. Had a steak which did not disappoint in terms of quality or quantity.

name: Stone Cliff Inn
address: 17900 S Clackamas River Dr Carver, OR  97045
review_description: I'M SORRY THEY WERE A LITTLE OVERWELMED WITH PEOPLE LAST WED. NIGHT. WE WERE THERE FOR MY DAUGHTER'S BIRTHDAY AND THE FOOD WASN'T UP TO PAR. MY DINNER ARRIVED AFTER MY FAMILY WAS FINISHED EATING. I WOULD HAVE NOT CHARGED FOR IT. MAYBE, IN THE FUTURE, THEY MIGHT OFFER THIS. STONE CLIFF IS STILL GOING TO BE ON OUR LIST OF NICE PLACES TO GO.

name: Riverview Restaurant
review_description: The goat cheese and fig crostini wasn't toasted; Tuna Roll was pretty tasteless without the super salty soy sauce. The teaspoon size clumps of candied hazelnuts in the strawberry salad could have broken a tooth. The a tomato, bean (3) squash soup was completely blah of taste. The Miso Salmon with Gingered Rice was nothing memorable. The cut of fish was so thin I was reminded of a low grade pink salmon. The broccolini was among the toughest I've ever ever eaten. The Lamb Ossobucco on a bed of parmesan polenta was completely sad. The lamb was totally overcooked, tasteless and grizzly. Of all the lamb we've eaten around the world, this was the absolute worst. The polenta was runny and not very flavorful. Our wait staff, Cassie was superb

name: Stanford's - Tanasbourne
review_description: Perfect table and location. Just what I asked for.

name: Slide Inn
review_description: After waiting 1 1/2 hours for our dinner, we left this eatery. We did manage to snag a pretzel or 2 and someone did open our wine.

name: Stanford's - Kruse Way (Lake Oswego)
address: 14801 Kruse Oaks Blvd Lake Oswego, OR  97035
review_description: We had a wonderful dinner--we were seated in an area where we were able to visit and talk and laugh and appreciate very much, the care the host took to fulfill our request for just such a table. All our needs were met and our dinner was delicious. Thank you very much.

name: The Stockpot Broiler
address: 8200 SW Scholls Ferry Rd Beaverton, OR  97008
review_description: The server was really nice. He took our picture when we asked, brought us free champaigne for our anniversary, and provided great service. The food was delicious and the guy who was giving us water kept our glasses full. Great experience

name: The Grant House
review_description: Had requested a window seat having been there before and this was provided for us.

name: Tapalaya
review_description: I took my girlfriend here for our 3 yr anniversary. We really enjoyed the music and the menu. You have a great variety of food. Very enjoyable!

name: Portland Prime
review_description: My group and I thought the food and service was fantastic, in a great setting.

name: The Painted Lady
review_description: I was very pleased with the exceptional service and the food was outstanding. We celbrated my wife's birthday there and they were very attentive to the occassion. I would definatly recomend this restaraunt if you are looking for a great dining experience.

name: Thirsty Lion at Washington Square
address: 10205 SW Washington Square Rd Tigard, OR  97223
review_description: Great food and our waitress was absolutely amazing. Very quick service and wit. She was a joy and every person in our group of 6 had a fantastic meal.

name: Gracie's
review_description: The menu here is split between a couple of dozen "small plates" $6-$14 each and 8 larger dinners (mid-$20). This works very well for smaller appetites like ours. It also encourages sharing, which we did, by ordering 3 small plates and a dinner. All food was exceptionally well prepared and had the perfect balance of flavours. Wine list was not extensive, but more than adequate and priced mid-range. The ambience is very quiet and the restaurant furnishings are very comfortable. Only warning is that this place is more about quality than quantity, so those with larger appetites, used to "meat & potatoes", may not feel satisfied. But we loved it so much, we're looking forward to returning very soon.

name: Tina's
review_description: Still is a great restaurant in the wine country. The new chef carries on the excellent reputation of this place. The menu is relatively short but provides a nice array of imaginative options. And the wine list is a show case of the area.

name: Trebol Mexican
review_description: LOVED Trebol! My only complaint was that the place seemed understaffed. The staff they did have was doing an amazing job however!That and our guacamole was almost entirely inedible as the avocado was hard. It should have never been sent out and when we pointed it out nothing was done to compensate... tho we did have a living social deal so that may have been why. Will definitely go again!

name: Truss
review_description: We were dissappointed in the change in menu which limited the vegetarian options. The server was extremely helpful and made the experience. The trout was excellent. The bread served with the salad was stale - and not up to par with Portland breads. Very close to the Keller and a good option for a quick meal but little ambiance- what happened to the view of the river?

name: Tucci Ristorante
review_description: Outstanding restaurant, although expensive, is one we love for special occasions as our recent anniversary.

name: Venti's Cafe & Taphouse
review_description: Always great!Great staff, great food, great beer selection!

name: Wildwood Restaurant and Bar
review_description: Wildwood may not get the hype it once had nor the hipster cred that other restaurants have, but you won't find a better combination of great food, great service and great wine list anywhere.

name: 20nine Restaurant & Wine Bar
address: 255 E Basse Rd Ste 940 San Antonio, TX  78209
review_description: This is a great place for a romantic evening or a social gathering. Be prepared to spend about $100 for 2 but it's worth it. The goat cheese is wonderful by the way.

name: Acenar
review_description: Ok food. Drink prices were outrageous. Pretty dissapointing.

name: Achiote - Grand Hyatt San Antonio
address: 600 E. Market St. San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: For our first visit, we went specifically for the daily buffet. We arrived @ 130P, the buffet ends @ 200P, and we NEVER felt rushed; instead, all of the food, including the beef tenderloin, lamb, chicken sausage, and the guy that carves them, stayed available until we were finished. We enjoyed *everything* that we ate. Of special note was our server, Beth - attentive but not too, friendly but not too, available but not too - we hate "hovering," and Beth was perfect in every way. She is also a genuinely interesting & delightful person. My partner and I felt completely comfortable w/ her, and w/ all of the staff @ Achiote. We will definitely return on our next visit to SA - may even go back for dinner tomorrow.

name: Aldino Cucina Italiano
address: 1203 N Loop 1604 W  #101 San Antonio, TX  78258
review_description: The best flounder we've ever had! - fresh, moist and perfectly prepared with a light, delicious sauce. Our waitress was charming, friendly and extremely efficient. We highly recommend this restaurant.

name: Aldo's Ristorante Italiano
review_description: Beautiful restaurant set in an old residence. Although on a busy street, it is well shielded by trees which keep the interior quiet and provide an nice view. We ate inside, but there is a nice, shaded patio dining area.

name: Antlers Lodge
address: 9800 Hyatt Resort Drive San Antonio, TX  78251
review_description: Great food and the hotel is a beautiful place to walk off that great meal!

name: Bella...On The River
review_description: Our experience at Bella was magnificant. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and appeared to be a seasoned waiter. His service was perfect, just attentive enough. The prices were good as well. My hubby and I went for a "get away" week end and we will return. Thank you Bella

name: Biga on the Banks
address: 203 S. St. Mary's St. San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Biga has a great reputation and for good reason. The food is above average (the oyster appetizer is fantastic) and the service is top drawer. It is rather loud and th arrangement for large parties leaves a little to be desired. However over all an excellent evening of great food and wine. I would strongly recommend it for those visiting the Alamo City.

name: Bliss Restaurant
address: 926 S Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78210
review_description: Our meals were delicious! We started with oyster sliders and duck egg rolls. They, along with our meals (scallops & tuna) were incredible! The atmosphere is modern, hip, and unique - highly recommend trying Bliss!! We will be back.

name: Bohanan's Prime Steaks and Seafood
address: 219 East Houston Street Suite 275 San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: The food was good and the service excellent. The decor is nice, but the lack of attention to detail during the construction phase of decorating is obvious. The interior design is also lacking a certain elegance that is more common in upscale dining in NY.

name: Bourbon Street Seafood Kitchen
address: 2815 North Loop 1604 E. San Antonio, TX  78232
review_description: My favorite cajun seafood restaurant!

name: Brannon's Cafe
address: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
review_description: Typical Texas hotel food, except probably pricier since it's a Westin.

name: Cappy's Restaurant
review_description: We love Cappy's and keep coming back but for the for the first time we were Very disappointed in the food. Table ordered Swordfish x 2, Mustang Chicken and the Texas Platter. We were all very disappointed. Appetizers were wonderful but all 4 of us felt our entrees were very bland despite the nice presentation. Service was very very good as usual but food substandard

name: Chart House Restaurant - Tower of the Americas
address: 601 Tower of the Americas Way San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Excellent dining experience. The only drawback was the wait for our reservation. The reservation was for 7:30 and we didn't get seated for a little over an hour. It was Saturday night and I requested a window table. When we were finally were seated, we were directed to a booth across from the window that would have seated at least six. I told the host that we were only a party of two and would like what we requested. We were promptly seated at a window table for two. The hour wait was spent in the bar and it was very nice too. I had looked at the menu on line and had an idea what I wanted. We ordered and one of the entrees ordered was not available and the dessert we were looking forward to, the souffle, was also not available.

name: Citrus @ Hotel Valencia Riverwalk
address: 150 East Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Great food all around.Shrimp appetizers were plentiful and filling. 1 order was enough for two.Tomato salad was also delicious.Kristi, our waitress, recommended the Snapper which was very good and complemented by the caramelized onion and whatever type of grain it was served over.The original bottle of wine I ordered was out of stock but she recommended an excellent replacement. Which we went out and bought a bottle for the house.Thank you Kristi for your excellent service and charming personality.Slight draw back was the extreme quietness of the restaurant. There was no low playing or mild mood music and I could hear nearby conversations. The clanking of people dining was also noticeable due how quiet it was.

name: Drew's American Grill
address: 18740 Stone Oak Parkway San Antonio, TX  78258
review_description: Awesome service and food. Standout was attention to detail.

name: Esquire Tavern
review_description: A local place to see for the bar. On that note, menu is limited, fried bar food. View and ambiance are the highlight here.

name: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - San Antonio
address: 255 East Basse Road Suite 200 San Antonio, TX  78209
review_description: Table was ready on time, the bone in ribeye was fantastic and prepared perfectly. The service was attentive and timed well. My only drawback was the "noise". I guess it was more "energy" than noise. I was there with my daughters for a special dinner and the 3 of us noted there seemed to be more stimulation then at other similar restaurants.I will go back though, FYI. Great overall.

name: Francesca's at Sunset
address: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
review_description: Great place to eat.La Canterra was such a great place to take my wife on her 30th b-day.We both loved the ambiance,food and service indeed...Will be back again

name: Frederick's Bistro
address: 14439 NW Military Highway Suite 100 San Antonio, TX  78231
review_description: As usual, food and service were wonderful. I had the lamb chops - so delicious! One of my dining partners had the stuffed chicken and she was very happy with her entree. Will definitely be back!

name: The Grill at Leon Springs
review_description: The fish is always outstanding. Probably the best in San Antonio.

name: The Gruene Door
address: 2360 Gruene Lake Dr New Braunfels, TX  78130
review_description: Greeted and welecomed in a very professional fashion. We were seated in an area which I had asked for as a "quiet and cozy" and as it turns out, most of the area we were in was just that.The server was "Davey", she was very knowledgeable on the menu and kept us well attended to.Our company here in town has used this restraunt before on other business venues, but for a personal outing, it serves quite well.

name: Jerusalem Grill
review_description: The service was excellent. I liked the atmosphere. I will be back. Thanks

name: JW Marriott San Antonio - 18 Oaks
review_description: Wonderful menu filled with organic and locally produced ingredients. Every dish was excellent and the service was fantastic. Beautiful view overlooking the golf course. Incredible Brunch!

name: JW Marriott San Antonio - Cibolo Moon
review_description: The wine list is very limited.... very few choices if you are into wine. The menu is also limited. Very pleasant atmosphere and decor... nice view of the JW Marriott grounds.

name: JW Marriott San Antonio - High Velocity
review_description: We were just going to eat & have some drinks, then the Hostess let me know about a Special Beer Pairing Dinner. So glad she did. We had a group of 6 & we all had a Fabulous time! We will definitely be going again! Thanks!

name: Kirby's Prime Steakhouse - San Antonio
review_description: Everything was perfect...food, service, atmosphere and the jazz band that was playing was an added plus for the evening! Thank you!

name: Kona Grill - San Antonio
address: 15900 La Cantera Parkway The Shops At La Cantera San Antonio, TX  78256
review_description: Enjoyed the food and service! My dining companion had the pork loin, which I had a bite of, it was delicious! I had the mac-nut chicken, so tasty, reminded me of Hawaii! We will definitely return to Kona to try other dishes.

name: La Cascada - The Resort at Tapatio Springs
review_description: We celebrated our anniversary at La Cascada and had a wonderful time. The food was excellent and the vie outstanding.

name: La Fonda on Main
address: 2415 N. Main Ave San Antonio, TX  78212
review_description: Way above expectations in every way.

name: Las Canarias - Omni La Mansion
review_description: We've brunches and dined at Las Canarias many times in our frequent visits to San Antonio.. It deserves the high praise it has garnered on this site, Zagat guides and elsewhere. Incredible service with thoughtfully, well prepared food. Really a gem of San Antonio dining!

name: Las Ramblas at Hotel Contessa
address: 306 West Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: This is a great place for Spannish food. While the Paella is not as good as my last trip to Spain it certainly a great choice in San Antonio. The tapas were well thought out and tasty; there was an even assortment between vegetable adn meet; the standard offereings such as Jambon were there as well as unusal ones.

name: Liberty Bistro
address: 200 N. Seguin Ave. New Braunfels, TX  78130
neighborhood: Hill Country out of New Braunfels
review_description: Excellent find! The lamb was the best I've ever had. The food was as good as any upscale restaurant in New Braunfles if not better.

name: The Little Aussie Bakery & Cafe
review_description: It's a quiet little spot with a focus on serving great tasting food to finicky people. They do gluten-free with flair. Only EVOO. The mango chicken is the best chicken I've had in forever.

name: Little Gretel
review_description: We took my dad there for Father's Day brunch and the food,setting and service were all fabulous. We all tried something different from Eggs Benedict, The Reuben, Crabcake Salad, Lox, Sausage Trio plate and my 2 year old especially loved the mac n cheese fritters. We will certainly be back. We had fun feeding the ducks across the street when we were finished too. 5 Stars across the board!

name: Luce Ristorante E Enoteca
review_description: Had a great meal. I think people sometimes forget that Luce provides a great dining experience. If you haven't tried it in a while, you should go again.

name: Luke San Antonio
address: 125 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Noisy and a large amount of elevator traffic. Not well suited for special occasion dining.

name: Maggiano's - San Antonio
address: 17603 Interstate I-10 W San Antonio, TX  78257
review_description: excellent experiance....will be back

name: MAX's Wine Dive - San Antonio
address: 340 East Basse Road, Suite 101 San Antonio, TX  78209
review_description: LOVED the food!! I thought about it the whole next day!!! The happy hour prices were not so happy, but the food more than made up for the price of the wine.

name: The Melting Pot - San Antonio
address: 14855 Blanco Rd,  Suite 110 San Antonio, TX  78216
review_description: Our server G was the best and we would go back on a night he was working any day! The food was great have been to two other melting pots and this one might be my new favorite!

name: Morton's The Steakhouse - San Antonio
address: 300 E. Crockett Street Suite 283 San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Staff was exceptional. First class service.

name: Myron's at Alon Town Center
address: 10003 NW Military Hwy, Ste 2101 San Antonio, TX  78231
review_description: Wow! We go here a lot and the food and service is always top notch! I was happy to see it very crowded! Seems others have found my favorite spot! You have advanced to "hot spot!". Stephanie is a super server and the extra touches I requested went off beautifully! Myron's always goes above and beyond!

name: Myron's Prime Steak House
neighborhood: Hill Country out of New Braunfels
review_description: We were in town celebrating my husbands birthday, and it was the perfect place for a romantic dinner.

name: NAO
address: 312 Pearl Parkway Bldg 2 Suite 2102 San Antonio, TX  78215
review_description: This was our second trip to NAO and the results were mixed compared to our first trip. My wife thought the food was better,I thought it was slightly inferior. The biggest problem was it was very slow (2 hours for three courses) despite the fact it was almost empty. This may portend problems on weekends! As before the quality of ingredients was excellent. The jicama tacos were very refreshing.The octopus appetizer was very good, and the duck confit was excellent. Dinner partners gave their dishes similar praise.

name: Old San Francisco
review_description: I love the atmosphere of the Old San Francisco...so friendly, warm, fun, and so unique. A beautiful bar and the girl swinging and hitting the bell are just a part of the fantastic ambience. But what was particularly amazing was the quality of ALL the dishes we tried, not just the steaks! Amazing food at such a reasonable price. Other steak houses charge much more for the steak and all the sides are extra. But OSF provides a salad and your choice of 2 side dishes with your steak...all for less than you would pay just for the steak at other fine steakhouses. We definitely will return to try other dishes. We highly recommend this place without reservation!

name: Oro at The Emily Morgan Hotel
address: 705 E Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Went on a Friday night, we're just looking for a decent place for dinner. Menu on website was not what was available, but we did not have a hard time finding things to eat. Food was delicious. Service left a little bit to be desired, but wouldn't keep us from going back. Very cool building. Definitely recommend giving it a try.

name: Ostra at Mokara Hotel & Spa
address: 212 W. Crockett St. San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: It was a totally enjoyable experience. The staff were very attentive, the menu was creative, and the food was well prepared. I normally dine outside, but the temperature was a bit high for some of my guests. I can see that this would be a wonderful experience, seasonally.

name: Ounce Steakhouse
address: 1401 N Loop 1604 W Suite 105 San Antonio, TX  78258
review_description: Steaks were very pricy but all other things on the menu were very reasonable. Very nice place.

name: Palm Restaurant - San Antonio
address: 233 East Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Staek was prepared as ordered.Patrick is the Perfect waiter. Everyone should ask for him.

name: Paloma Blanca Mexican Cuisine
review_description: Thanks Nelly!! Well done as always!!

name: Perry's Steakhouse & Grille-San Antonio
address: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Suite 22200 San Antonio, TX  78256
review_description: Clearly one of the top two meals of this type I have eaten in San Antonio in the last 10 years. Every course was better than the one before. Great service, flexible atmosphere.

name: Piatti - San Antonio
address: 255 East Basse Street San Antonio, TX  78209
review_description: We always enjoy eating there. We think the food is great!

name: Q on the Riverwalk - Hyatt Regency
review_description: I was suspicious of a bbq restaraunt in a major hotel and I should have followed my instincts: we ordered the baby back ribs and when they arived the presentation was appealing however the ribs were tasteless with a blah sauce. Our server was great and the wine ist was acceptable. If Q can ramp up the food, this could be a geat dining experience.

name: Restaurant Gwendolyn
review_description: Comsistently great food from Chef Michael since he opened. Some turnover on the service side noted on this visit, but servers have always seemed professional and knowledgeable about the concept.

name: Roaring Fork San Antonio
review_description: first waitress was like a robot; with little personality; did not make us feel like this was a special dining place; but was repalced by the waiter Henry who changed our opinion. He was quite professional; what one would expect of a place like this. ordred the carnitas, but got an end cut that was quite fatty and very little was eatable. Henry finaly made it back around to check on things and when we explained the problem he immeately exchanged the entire plate. very nice, but that was half way thru the meal and so she was begining when i was ending. friday special grilled prokchop was quite large and very good. not a good first impression.

name: RoMo's Cafe
review_description: Not a professional restaurant. Really should not be on open table. We had a group Of 12. This was for a business dinner.There is not ambiance. It is a store front with a bunch of metal tables and chairs.No decor, period.Wait staff nice, polite, but absolutely not trained nor professional. Food was fine, presentations poor. I Had aChicken in in wine sauce, that was poorly platedAnd the presentation, there wasn't presentation. It looked very bad on the plate. Bluntly, not a restaurant for folks looking to entertain customers.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Antonio (Airport)
address: 7720 Jones Maltsberger Concord Plaza San Antonio, TX  78216
review_description: Still the best steakhouse in town. First on our list for special occasions.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Antonio (Downtown)
address: 1170 E. Commerce Street Sunset Station St. Paul Square San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: As requested, we had the priviate dining area downstairs and it was just perfect for the business that neeed to be conducted! Thank you for your extra efforts!

name: Sazo's Latin Grill
review_description: It is a hotel restaurant attached to the Marriott Riverfront. When I arrived a few minutes early for my reservation, they told me that they were closing because they didn't have enough diners. So much for that.

name: Scuzzi's Italian Grill
address: 4035 N Loop 1604 W, Ste 102 San Antonio, TX  78257
review_description: 6th dinner visit with friends. Good, dependable, but not a standout. However, everyone left happy.

name: Silo Elevated Cuisine - 1604
review_description: Silo, is a beautiful restaurant, we were impressed with its looks, atmosphere and food. We will recommend it to our friends and make it a place we will frequent as well. Great first impression.

name: Silo Elevated Cuisine - Alamo Heights
review_description: This is my second time at Silo and it still did not disappoint. The service was good, great ambiance and parking on a Sunday was MUCH better than a Friday/Saturday dinner. Both meals I've had were wonderful, so it was easy to overlook the dessert not being up to par. However, they have made a permanent customer. It definitely is in the top 5 list of restaurants that I would choose for a special occasion of if I am craving a high quality meal.

name: Stone Werks - Lincoln Heights
review_description: Mother's Day - food was less than normal, not bad but not great either. Service was also sporadic - good for a while then non-existent then good again.

name: Stone Werks - The Rim
review_description: Ambiance is nice, but kind of noisy--better for large groups. Would recommend more for drinks and apps than dinner. Dinner meals are average, not great for the price. Burgers are probably most reasonable.

name: Stone Werks - The Vineyard
address: 1201 N Loop 1604 W #101 San Antonio, TX  78258
review_description: Customer service was outstanding! The place was packed and we still had very timely service. The staff was very accommodating. Great atmosphere for adults and children. Live entertainment was awesome. Overall we loved the environment. We will be back.

name: Sushi Zushi - Colonnade
review_description: Food was great but service was slow and lacked enthusiasmOveral an average experienceStill a great place for everyday eating

name: Sushi Zushi - Downtown
address: 203 South Saint Mary's San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Great sushi and great service - thank you Daniel!!

name: Sushi Zushi - Lincoln Heights
address: 999 E. Basse Road Ste. 186 San Antonio, TX  78209
review_description: Sushi Zushi is our go-to option when we don't feel like making dinner. Food is good, consistent, and servers are always nice, we've never had a problem. I will say the Lincoln heights location is usually pretty noisy which is good if you have a group. One dissapointing dish we ordered, which doesn't happen much, was an appetizer of seared tuna crusted with pepper. Came with little hint of pepper and none of the sauce that was supposed to be on it, and was a pretty small portion.

name: Sustenio - Eilan Hotel
address: 17103 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
review_description: Looking out the picture windows while sipping my wine, I felt like I was on vacation in Europe. Made a dinner of three appetizers which was more than enough but I wanted to try lots of dishes. Unobtrusive but friendly server gave excellent advice on my selections. Looking forward to dining here again.

name: Toscana Ristorante - Downtown
address: 301 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: 2nd time eating here. Food was good but not exceptional. Bar service is slow. Waitstaff is polite, pleasant & attentive but unpolished ... clearly they are lacking in training.

name: Tre Trattoria Downtown
review_description: I really want to like this place, but they just can't seem to get their act together. The food ranges from "OK" to "Outstanding" - same with the service! We were there for Sunday Brunch and the memosas were great. Three of the six entrees were "outstanding" - the fried chicken with waffles, the steak and eggs and the pork chop. The other three, not so much - green eggs & ham, duck confit hash and breakfast pizza - they were not bad, just not much to them. Very little ham and very little duck; the pizza was unremarkable. Just not what we expect for the price.

name: Wildfish Seafood Grille - San Antonio
review_description: Amazing place to have a special occasion!! Food was wonderful, service was outstanding and I will definitely come back!!!

name: Zinc Bistro & Wine Bar
address: 207 North Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: I eat at Zinc all the time. The food is outstanding and it's easier to get a table here than at its sister restaurant Boudro's. The Shrimp Po-Boy is a must on your visit if you like a great Po-Boy sandwich. Food is always very consistent and the bar scene gets very vibrant. Outside patio welcomes cigars, so it's a great place to enjoy a good cigar and a glass of wine. Huge wine list and full bar. Hamburgers are also excellent as well as everything else on the menu.

name: Zocca
address: 420 W. Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: The food was excellent and the service was top notch.

name: Z'Tejas San Antonio
address: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Ste 25100 San Antonio, TX  78256
review_description: One issue wiqth an undercooked meal but theey were really on top of it zand tok care of us without us having fo ask.

name: Luke San Antonio
address: 125 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Noisy and a large amount of elevator traffic. Not well suited for special occasion dining.

name: Luke San Antonio
address: 125 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
review_description: Noisy and a large amount of elevator traffic. Not well suited for special occasion dining.
